thread.title: Premier League team of the week: Hat-trick hero Harry Kane stars but who else makes the Mirror Football XI?
thread.title_full: Premier League team of the week: Hat-trick hero Harry Kane stars but who else makes the Mirror Football XI?

author: Matt Lawless
title: Premier League team of the week: Hat-trick hero Harry Kane stars but who else makes the Mirror Football XI?
text:
Kane claimed the matchball at White Hart Lane (Photo: Reuters) Share Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
There were goals galore in what was a fabulous weekend of Premier League football. 
With huge wins for Hull and Burnley, beaten rivals Swansea, Sunderland and Crystal Palace suffered setbacks in their battle for survival. 
At the top of the table, Tottenham and Arsenal scored bumper wins. 
But leaders Chelsea refused to offer any favours to their chasing foes with a comprehensive victory over champions Leicester. 
Manchester City's title challenge took a real battering at the hands of Everton, while a draw at Old Trafford did no favours for either Liverpool or Manchester United. 
So, which players stood out over the weekend? It wasn't an easy one to pick, but here is Mirror Football's team of the week (featuring the classic 4-4-2)... Simon Mignolet Mignolet made a string of fine stops against United (Photo: 2017 Getty Images) 
There is no doubting his No.1 status in a Reds shirt now after making several superb saves against Manchester United. Seamus Coleman Coleman helped Everton to a 4-0 win over Man City (Photo: Michael Regan / Getty) 
Lived up to his 'mustard' nickname with a helping hand in two of Everton's goals in their 4-0 hammering over Manchester City. Dejan Lovren Lovren battles Fellaini (Photo: John Peters / Manchester United FC) 
A nuisance for Paul Pogba at set-pieces, the Croatian helped Liverpool win a first-half penalty at Old Trafford. Shkodran Mustafi Mustafi still hasn't lost as an Arsenal player (Photo: Stu Forster) 
Yet to taste defeat in an Arsenal shirt since his summer arrival from Valencia, keeping his sixth clean sheet in 20 outings. Keep that man fit, Monsieur Wenger. Marcos Alonso Alonso proved the unlikeliest of two-goal heroes (Photo: REUTERS) 
The left-back scored twice at Leicester to keep Chelsea's title challenge on course. Who needs Diego Costa? Michail Antonio Antonio provided three assists against Palace (Photo: REUTERS) 
The West Ham winger climbed out of his sick bed to provide all three assists in a fantastic display against Crystal Palace. Who needs Dimitri Payet? Tom Davies The midfielder scores his first senior goal (Photo: Michael Regan) 
The Toffees teenager was terrific in the middle of the park and was duly rewarded with his first senior goal. Alexis Sanchez Sanchez struck for the 14th time this season against Swansea (Photo: Getty Images) 
The Chilean was on target again at the weekend. He has been involved in more goals than any other Premier League player - 21 in total, scoring 14 with seven assists. No wonder Arsenal want him to stay. Marko Arnautovic Arnautovic scored twice for Stoke at Sunderland (Photo: Getty) 
The Austrian was in devastating form for Stoke at the Stadium of Light with two powerful finishes. Harry Kane Who's the daddy? Kane celebrated the birth of his first child with a hat-trick against West Brom (Photo: Reuters) 
The England striker welcomed his newborn baby into the world with a stunning hat-trick to fire Spurs into second He's the daddy alright. Andy Carroll A moment of magic from the big man (Photo: AFP) 
If you haven't watched the big man's glorious scissor kick yet, then do so. Right now. And watch it all over, again and again and again. Outstanding from the West Ham forward. poll loading Will Harry Kane win the golden boot? 0+ VOTES SO FAR
